title: Zora pushes Base ahead of Solana's Pump.fun and LetsBonk
body: Coinbase’s Ethereum layer-2 network Base has overtaken Solana as the top ecosystem for launching memecoins, buoyed by a surge in token creations on the Zora platform in recent weeks. On Wednesday, Zora alone accounted for 23,419 newly launched tokens, surpassing both LetsBonk and Pump.fun , two of Solana’s most active launchpads, according to blockchain data tracked by @sealaunch_team on Dune Analytics. the majority of new coins are now created on @base pic.twitter.com/RjGhbX9MwV — jesse.base.eth (@jessepollak) July 29, 2025 In total, 52,507 tokens were launched on several platforms, but Zora was responsible for 44.6% of that activity. LetsBonk followed with 19,593 tokens, or 37.3% of the total, while Pumpdotfun contributed 4,764 tokens, making up 9% of the overall count. The remaining volume came from Moonshot (2,407), Bags (1,053), and Believeapp (423), among others. Zora takes Base over Solana in token launching activity According to Coinbase director Conor Grogan, this is the first time that another chain has had more tokens launched on it than Solana since 2023. Zora, the creator-first protocol operating on Base, saw around 6,500 new tokens launched per day last month. On Monday, however, token creation through Zora spiked to a record 51,575 in a single day. The platform effectively contributed 67.7% of all token creation volume across Base and Solana combined on that day. Moreover, internal platform data shows Zora recorded over 2 million monthly active users in July, with more than 77,000 new users joining in the past week alone. Co-founder Jacob Home confirmed the figures in a podcast interview earlier this week, stating, “2 million users have signed into Zora in the last month, 54,000 coins were deployed yesterday, and over the weekend we did $63 million in volume.” $ZORA token on a parabolic price rally In tandem with the launch surge, the $ZORA token, issued by the Zora protocol on Base, has rallied more than 83% over the past week. At the time of this publication, it is trading at $0.078 with a market capitalization of about $251 million, 63% over the valuation recorded on July 23. $ZORA’s price has moved north of 800% from July 9-30, according to data from Coingecko. But after counting weeks of gains, the upward acceleration has seemingly cooled off, and analysts have predicted a short-term bearish momentum building in the short term, with a potential 30% correction targeting the $0.060 range. Market watchers noted that late short positions may be vulnerable to liquidations before any meaningful support structure breaks. Despite the warnings, no clear resistance levels have been identified above current prices. Zora creator coin value debate Zora’s launchpad activity and its native token’s recent price rally started a debate in crypto circles about the fundamental value of creator coins. Jesse Pollak, who leads development on Coinbase’s Base network, believes creator tokens differ significantly from anonymously launched coins on platforms like Pump.fun. Pollak referenced specific creator tokens like $rasmr and $gainzy, arguing that they are tied to identifiable individuals and creative output. “It’s myopic to say that all these are the same,” he said in a July 27 X post, responding to naysayers questioning the legitimacy of these assets. That’s not the only way tokens can be fundamentally differentiated. For example, by tying the coin to a creator’s identity/art instead of just a meme it’s an incentive to develop a positive reputation instead of instadump and farm. — ruz.eth ♢ he/they (@RuzhyoX) July 27, 2025 The developer also explained that “the content itself is fundamentally valuable,” likening the worth of a creator token to that of a painting, where the value is upheld even if no admission fees are charged. Solana co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko, however, bashed Pollak’s assertions, claiming that unless creator tokens gave holders claims to future cash flows or tangible off-chain assets, they are objectively “speculative instruments.” KEY Difference Wire helps crypto brands break through and dominate headlines fast

title: China Cracks Down on $19.5M Crypto Money Laundering Ring Using Mixing Services
body: Former tech executive sentenced to 14+ years for embezzling $19.5M via crypto . Feng used crypto mixers and 8 crypto platforms to hide funds before converting to yuan. Beijing authorities order the surrender of 90 hidden bitcoins worth over $11 million. Chinese authorities have detailed a major cryptocurrency money laundering operation involving a former technology executive who embezzled 140 million yuan ($19.5 million) from his employer. The Beijing Haidian People’s Procuratorate revealed how the defendant used eight overseas virtual currency platforms to convert stolen funds into bitcoin and other digital assets. The executive, identified by surname Feng, used coin mixing strategies to hide the origin of laundered money before converting portions back to yuan for mainland bank transfers. According to SCMP , prosecutor Li Tao from the hi-tech crime division reconstructed the complete embezzlement and laundering process to build criminal charges against Feng and his associates. Court Orders Bitcoin Surrender and Prison Sentence Feng received a sentence exceeding 14 years in prison and must surrender 90 “hidden” Bitcoins valued at over $11 million at curr… The post China Cracks Down on $19.5M Crypto Money Laundering Ring Using Mixing Services appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: Hyperliquid Refund: Guaranteed Relief After Critical API Outage
body: BitcoinWorld Hyperliquid Refund: Guaranteed Relief After Critical API Outage In the fast-paced world of decentralized finance (DeFi), where every second counts, an unexpected hiccup can send ripples of concern through the community. Recently, the popular decentralized perpetual futures exchange, Hyperliquid (HYPE), faced just such a challenge: an API server outage on July 29th that temporarily delayed trades for over 30 minutes. However, Hyperliquid’s swift and transparent response, including a commitment to an automated Hyperliquid refund for affected users, has turned a potential crisis into a testament to their dedication to user trust and platform resilience. What Exactly Happened During the Hyperliquid API Outage? The incident, which occurred on July 29th, saw Hyperliquid’s API servers experience a significant disruption. This wasn’t a malicious attack or a hack, which is often a primary concern in the crypto space. Instead, as Hyperliquid clarified on its official Telegram channel and as reported by The Block, the outage was primarily caused by an unforeseen surge in traffic. Imagine a highway suddenly inundated with far more cars than it was designed to handle – that’s essentially what happened to Hyperliquid’s API infrastructure. This surge led to delayed trade executions, a critical issue for a platform where timing is everything for perpetual futures traders. For traders, even a brief delay can mean missed opportunities or unexpected losses. The inability to execute trades promptly, or to have orders delayed, directly impacts their ability to manage positions and react to market fluctuations. Recognizing the potential impact on its user base, Hyperliquid’s immediate priority was to diagnose and patch the issue, which it successfully did, restoring normal operations swiftly. But their commitment didn’t stop there; they understood that simply fixing the problem wasn’t enough to fully address the inconvenience and potential financial impact on their users. How Will the Hyperliquid Refund Process Work? In a move that underscores their user-centric approach, Hyperliquid announced that it would issue automated refunds to all users affected by the July 29th API server outage. While specific details regarding the mechanics of the Hyperliquid refund are still pending and will be shared soon, the commitment itself is a significant gesture. This proactive measure aims to compensate users for any potential losses or inconveniences directly attributable to the system downtime. The decision to automate the refund process is particularly noteworthy. It means users won’t need to jump through hoops, fill out complex forms, or engage in lengthy support ticket exchanges to receive their compensation. This streamlined approach reflects Hyperliquid’s understanding of user experience and their desire to minimize additional burden on those already impacted. An automated Hyperliquid refund process sets a high standard for how decentralized platforms can take responsibility and maintain user confidence, ensuring that traders can continue to operate on the platform with peace of mind. Why is This Hyperliquid Refund a Game-Changer for DEX Trust? In the decentralized world, trust is paramount, yet often challenging to build and maintain without centralized authorities. Incidents like API outages, while sometimes unavoidable, test the resilience and integrity of a platform. Hyperliquid’s decision to offer a Hyperliquid refund is more than just a gesture of goodwill; it’s a powerful statement about accountability and transparency in DeFi. This action helps to: Reinforce User Confidence: By proactively addressing the impact of the outage with financial compensation, Hyperliquid demonstrates a commitment to its users’ financial well-being, fostering a stronger sense of trust. Set an Industry Precedent: In an ecosystem where some platforms might shy away from direct financial compensation for technical glitches, Hyperliquid’s automated refund sets a benchmark for best practices in decentralized exchange operations. Highlight Decentralization’s Strengths: While the outage was a centralized component (API servers), the swift, transparent, and user-focused resolution aligns with the core values of decentralization – empowering users and fostering community trust through accountability. Mitigate FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt): Rapid and decisive action, coupled with clear communication about the cause (traffic surge, not hack) and the resolution (refunds), effectively counters potential negative narratives and maintains a positive perception of the platform. This incident, and Hyperliquid’s handling of it, could serve as a case study for other DEXs on how to manage technical challenges while upholding user trust and maintaining a robust reputation in a competitive market. Navigating Future Outages: Lessons from Hyperliquid’s Swift Response The July 29th incident provides valuable insights not just for Hyperliquid, but for the entire decentralized finance ecosystem. While a surge in traffic is a good problem to have, indicating growing popularity, it also highlights the need for scalable and robust infrastructure. Hyperliquid’s quick identification and patching of the issue demonstrate their technical prowess and preparedness. Their prompt communication via official channels further exemplifies effective crisis management. Lessons learned from this experience will undoubtedly feed into Hyperliquid’s future development, likely leading to enhancements in: Scalability Solutions: Investing further in infrastructure that can dynamically scale to handle unprecedented traffic spikes, ensuring uninterrupted service even during peak demand. Redundancy Measures: Implementing more redundant API servers and load-balancing mechanisms to prevent single points of failure. Proactive Monitoring: Enhancing real-time monitoring systems to detect potential bottlenecks or anomalies before they escalate into full-blown outages. Communication Protocols: Refining rapid communication strategies to keep users informed every step of the way during unforeseen events. The commitment to a Hyperliquid refund , while a reactive measure to the specific incident, also signals a proactive approach to user satisfaction and platform reliability in the long run. Beyond the Hyperliquid Refund: The Future of Decentralized Trading The incident with Hyperliquid, and their commendable response, sheds light on the evolving maturity of decentralized exchanges. As DEXs continue to gain traction and challenge traditional centralized exchanges, their ability to handle operational challenges, ensure security, and maintain user trust becomes paramount. The future of decentralized trading hinges not just on innovative financial instruments and liquidity, but also on the operational robustness and ethical conduct of the platforms themselves. Hyperliquid’s actions reinforce the idea that even in a decentralized environment, accountability is key. As the DeFi space matures, we can expect to see more platforms adopting similar high standards of transparency and user protection. This commitment to user well-being, exemplified by the upcoming Hyperliquid refund , is crucial for attracting mainstream adoption and building a sustainable future for decentralized finance. In conclusion, Hyperliquid’s recent API outage and its subsequent commitment to automated refunds for affected users is a powerful demonstration of accountability and user-centricity in the decentralized finance space. By swiftly patching the issue, transparently communicating the cause, and proactively offering a Hyperliquid refund , the DEX has not only mitigated the immediate impact of the incident but also significantly reinforced trust within its community. This approach sets a commendable precedent for how decentralized platforms can navigate operational challenges while upholding their core values of transparency and user empowerment, paving the way for a more resilient and trustworthy DeFi ecosystem. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What caused the Hyperliquid API outage on July 29th? The API outage on July 29th was caused by an unexpected surge in traffic to Hyperliquid’s servers, not by a hack or malicious activity. This surge overloaded the system, leading to delayed trade executions. Q2: Who is eligible for the Hyperliquid refund? Hyperliquid has announced that automated refunds will be issued to all users who were affected by the API server outage on July 29th. Specific criteria and details on what constitutes ‘affected’ will be shared by Hyperliquid soon. Q3: How will users receive their Hyperliquid refund? Hyperliquid has stated that the refunds will be automated, meaning users should not need to take any specific action to receive their compensation. Further details regarding the distribution method and timeline for the Hyperliquid refund will be announced on their official channels. Q4: Is Hyperliquid safe to use after this incident? Yes, Hyperliquid quickly identified and patched the issue that caused the outage. Their transparent communication and commitment to automated refunds demonstrate a strong dedication to platform integrity and user trust. The incident was due to a traffic surge, not a security breach. Q5: What steps is Hyperliquid taking to prevent future outages? While Hyperliquid has not released specific details yet, it is expected that they will enhance their infrastructure to handle higher traffic volumes, implement more robust redundancy measures, and improve real-time monitoring systems to prevent similar incidents in the future. Their proactive response suggests a commitment to continuous improvement. If you found this article insightful, consider sharing it with your network on social media! Help us spread the word about how platforms like Hyperliquid are building trust and resilience in the evolving world of decentralized finance. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping decentralized exchanges and their institutional adoption. This post Hyperliquid Refund: Guaranteed Relief After Critical API Outage first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Treehouse Launches TREE Token Across Binance, OKX, Coinbase, and Top Exchanges Following Token Generation Event
body: BitcoinWorld Treehouse Launches TREE Token Across Binance, OKX, Coinbase, and Top Exchanges Following Token Generation Event With listings on prominent CEXs and DEXs, Treehouse, the Decentralized Fixed Income Layer, activates TREE’s first utility via Pre-Deposit Vaults, offering up to 75% APR SINGAPORE , July 30, 2025 /PRNewswire/ — Treehouse , a digital assets infrastructure firm with over $550 million in Total Value Locked (TVL), just announced the launch of its native token, TREE , following the successful completion of its Token Generation Event (TGE), code-named Gaia . TREE is now live and available for trading on Tier-1 and major exchanges, including Binance, OKX, Coinbase, Bybit, Bitget, Gate, KuCoin, BitPanda, Kraken, Bitvavo, HTX, and MEXC, with more underway. As part of the launch, Treehouse activated the token’s first utility: Pre-Deposit Vaults , time-limited yield-bearing staking pools linked to the protocol’s Decentralized Offered Rates (DOR) consensus framework. Token holders can earn a guaranteed 50 to 75% APR by staking TREE to support rate forecasting Panelists. Pre-Deposit Vault staking is open for 30 days following TGE, with participation details available in Treehouse’s blog and documentation . Enabling On-Chain Fixed Income: DOR and tAssets Treehouse is building the foundational infrastructure for fixed income in decentralized finance through Decentralized Offered Rates (DOR) and tAssets . DOR is a consensus framework designed to bring structure and transparency to DeFi yields, similar to what LIBOR and SOFR provided in traditional finance. The protocol’s first published benchmark, the Treehouse Ethereum Staking Rate (TESR) , reflects ETH staking yields through daily forecasts from expert contributors, including Staking Rewards, RockX, and LinkPool. These benchmarks enable structured products, lending markets, and interest rate derivatives to emerge and scale on-chain. Complementing DOR is Treehouse’s expanding suite of tAssets —liquid staking primitives such as tETH , which are designed for yield generation and capital efficiency. They integrate staking and rate arbitrage strategies for more than 52,000 tAsset users , while remaining composable across DeFi, supporting broader utility and interoperability within the ecosystem. Together, DOR and tAssets form the critical infrastructure needed to support transparent, scalable fixed income markets on-chain, bringing transparency, predictability, and capital efficiency to decentralized finance. About TREE TREE is the native utility and governance token of the Treehouse Protocol. It serves multiple functions within the ecosystem, including: Staking to support DOR Panelists via Pre-Deposit Vaults Participating in governance for protocol upgrades and parameter changes Earning protocol rewards and consensus payouts based on forecast accuracy Paying on-chain fees for accessing benchmark rate data Treehouse is launching the TREE token with a community distribution of 10% via the GoNuts Season 1 rewards program. Eligible users can verify and redeem their allocation through the Treehouse Airdrop Checker on Gaia Foundation . Token Details Token Name: Treehouse Token Symbol: TREE Token Standard: ERC-20 Total Supply: 1,000,000,000 Initial Circulating Supply: [18.6% or 186,122,448.98] Contract Address: 0x77146784315Ba81904d654466968e3a7c196d1f3 ( ETH & BNB ) For a full tokenomics breakdown, refer to the Tokenomics Documentation . Strategy and Vision: The Decentralized Fixed Income Layer “TREE represents more than a token; it marks the activation of on‑chain fixed income infrastructure,” said Brandon Goh , Co‑founder and CEO of Treehouse Finance. “Treehouse is delivering the foundational infrastructure for real capital markets to thrive on-chain, paving the way for structured products, fixed-term lending, and risk-managed strategies historically limited to traditional finance.” Earlier this year, Treehouse announced its $400 million valuation following a successful funding round, a reflection of the growing institutional interest in fixed income within digital assets and confidence in Treehouse’s vision to build the decentralized yield layer for DeFi. Looking ahead, Treehouse is focused next on expanding tAssets to new base chains and layer‑2 networks, while introducing derivative primitives such as Forward Rate Agreements (FRAs), supporting both institutional and DeFi-native use cases at scale. For more information on TREE, the Pre-Deposit Vaults, or to participate in staking, visit the website , launch the Treehouse dApp , or follow Treehouse on X and Discord . About Treehouse Treehouse, a digital assets infrastructure firm and the decentralized arm of the parent company Treehouse Labs , is at the forefront of revolutionizing the decentralized fixed income market. Treehouse Protocol introduces innovative fixed income products and primitives, starting with its first tAsset, tETH , a liquid staking token that empowers its users to participate in the convergence of on-chain Ethereum interest rates while retaining the flexibility to engage in DeFi activities. Treehouse Protocol is also pioneering the Decentralized Offered Rates (DOR) consensus mechanism for benchmark rate setting, enabling a range of fixed income products and primitives into digital assets. Treehouse is dedicated to creating safer and more predictable return alternatives for both individual investors and institutions. Website: https://treehouse.finance X: https://x.com/TreehouseFi Discord: https://discord.gg/treehousefi About Treehouse Labs Treehouse Labs is the parent company of Treehouse and TRHX . The firm builds products that provide infrastructure, data, and standards, enabling people to invest in digital assets with confidence and foresight. Established in 2021, Treehouse Labs spans five locations and offers extensive expertise in traditional finance, digital assets, and data. By setting new benchmarks and creating robust financial tools, Treehouse Labs aims to bridge the gap between traditional finance and digital assets. Website: https://treehouselabs.xyz X: https://x.com/TRH_Labs LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/company/treehouselabs/ This post Treehouse Launches TREE Token Across Binance, OKX, Coinbase, and Top Exchanges Following Token Generation Event first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by chainwire

title: MEXC Blocks 70,000 Fraud Attempts in Q2, Reports 12% drop in Syndicate Attacks
body: Cryptocurrency exchange MEXC has released a new report showing a 12% quarter-over-quarter decline in fraud attempts stemming from organized fraud syndicates — a notable decrease following a sharp spike reported by the exchange in Q1 2025. According to the platform’s latest Q2 Risk Control Summary, 70621 fraud attempts linked to 8,501 criminal groups were intercepted between April and June 2025. MEXC credits the progress in combating fraudulent activities on its platform to AI-led surveillance systems and region-specific response strategies, including localized response teams and user education. “As fraud networks evolve, so must our response. Risk control is not punishment; it’s protection. said Tracy Jin, COO of MEXC. According to the report, South Asia saw the largest decline in illicit activity, marking a 41% drop, which was attributed to faster detection, rapid-response teams, and localized user education efforts. This follows a major concentration of syndicate-led fraud in the region in the previous report for Q1. South Asia remains a region of concern, with fraud attempts increasing by 11% QoQ. However, the region has seen a significant deceleration from the 1300% surge recorded in the previous quarter. Indonesia accounted for 73% of Southeast Asia’s fraud cases, posting an 18% rise, while Vietnam contributed 16% with a 35% increase. The CIS region, in contrast, recorded the highest relative increase among all regions at 83% though this represents a slower pace compared to the over 200% rise seen in Q1. AI-powered Risk Control Surveillance Gains Ground MEXC’s risk control framework leans heavily on advanced AI models capable of detecting anomalies in trading behaviour, login patterns, and outliers across both on-chain and off-chain environments. These surveillance systems analyse a large volume of user activities and automatically block suspicious activities or escalate them for human review. The platform reiterates that this AI-human hybrid approach has been key in reducing the success of fraud execution without negatively affecting legitimate user transactions. MEXC has now also integrated AI tools for real-time monitoring of market manipulation tactics like wash trading, spoofing, and pump-and-dump schemes. Countering Misinformation and Misunderstanding of the Risk Control Protocol Though risk control, surveillance, and fraud detection have improved, MEXC noted that user confusion and misinformation remain a persistent challenge. In some instances, fraud syndicates have launched retaliatory disinformation campaigns after thier accounts were restricted by the risk control systems, targeting user trust by distorting the purpose of the account restrictions. In Response, the platform announced it will roll out a global security education initiative in August. The campaign will include real-world case studies, simplified explainers on fraud detection models, and guidelines for secure trading. The gains we’ve made in Q2 are the result of early intervention, regional specialization, and smarter tools. But education remains key — we want users to understand not just what happens when an account is flagged, but why. Tracy Jin added further. MEXC's approach to platform integrity reflects a proactive approach at a time when fraud in the Web 3 industry remains a top concern. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: Illicit Crypto Activity: Telegram’s Decisive Crackdown Escalates War on $35B Scam Networks
body: BitcoinWorld Illicit Crypto Activity: Telegram’s Decisive Crackdown Escalates War on $35B Scam Networks In the ever-evolving digital landscape, the battle against financial crime is relentless. A recent, significant move by Telegram has sent ripples through the cryptocurrency world, highlighting the persistent challenge of illicit crypto activity . This isn’t just about a platform taking action; it’s a stark reminder of the sophisticated nature of modern financial scams and the global efforts to combat them. Telegram’s decisive ban on major scam networks, reportedly tied to a staggering $35 billion in illicit USDT trades, marks a critical escalation in the war against crypto-related crime. But as history often shows, shutting down one operation frequently leads to the emergence of others, transforming the fight into a complex, high-stakes game of digital cat-and-mouse. Understanding this dynamic is crucial for anyone involved in or impacted by the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Understanding the Threat: Why Illicit Crypto Activity Matters When we talk about illicit crypto activity , we’re not just discussing minor infractions. We’re delving into a dark underbelly where vast sums of money are laundered, scams proliferate, and unsuspecting individuals and organizations lose their hard-earned assets. The scale of the problem is immense, with estimates running into billions of dollars annually. These activities erode trust in the legitimate cryptocurrency market, attract negative regulatory scrutiny, and can even destabilize financial systems. The networks involved often exploit the decentralized and pseudonymous nature of cryptocurrencies, making them difficult to trace and dismantle. Erosion of Trust: Widespread scams deter new users and institutional investors from entering the crypto space. Regulatory Pressure: Governments and financial bodies become more inclined to impose stringent regulations, potentially stifling innovation. Financial Loss: Individuals and businesses suffer direct monetary losses, sometimes devastating their financial well-being. Reputational Damage: The entire crypto industry can be painted with a broad brush of illicit associations, hindering its mainstream adoption. The case of Huione and Xinbi Guarantee perfectly illustrates the magnitude of this threat. These weren’t small-time operations; they were extensive networks facilitating massive money laundering schemes, leveraging Telegram’s platform for communication and coordination. Their activities underscore the urgent need for platforms to take responsibility and for international cooperation to track and disrupt these illicit financial flows. Telegram’s Bold Move: Targeting Major Scam Networks Under significant pressure, particularly from U.S. authorities, Telegram took a momentous step by banning Huione and Xinbi Guarantee. These two entities were identified as central players in a web of illicit transactions, reportedly involving up to $35 billion in USDT, a stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar. This wasn’t a minor enforcement action; it was a direct hit at the operational core of major financial crime syndicates using the platform. The U.S. Treasury Department had previously labeled Huione as a significant money-laundering threat, imposing sanctions on associated cryptocurrency wallets. This move by U.S. authorities sent a clear message: platforms that facilitate such activities will face consequences. Telegram’s compliance, whether voluntary or coerced, signifies a growing acknowledgment among tech companies of their role in combating financial crime. Initial reports suggested a direct impact: Huione’s Volume Drop: Following the ban, Huione’s transaction volume reportedly plummeted by 50%. This immediate reduction indicates the effectiveness of severing their primary communication and coordination channels on Telegram. Xinbi Guarantee’s Disruption: While specific initial figures were less detailed, Xinbi also faced significant disruption, impacting its ability to operate seamlessly. This crackdown highlights a critical aspect of the ongoing fight against illicit crypto activity : the importance of cutting off communication arteries that these networks rely on. While blockchain transactions are public, the coordination, recruitment, and instruction often happen on private messaging platforms, making their cooperation essential. The Shifting Landscape of Illicit Crypto Activity: A Digital Cat-and-Mouse Game While Telegram’s bans delivered a significant blow, the nature of illicit crypto activity is highly adaptive. Criminal networks rarely disappear; they simply evolve and relocate. This adaptability quickly became apparent after the initial bans, revealing a dynamic and challenging environment for law enforcement and platforms alike. Consider the immediate aftermath: Network Initial Action Impact on Volume Subsequent Behavior Huione Banned by Telegram, sanctioned by US 50% volume drop Ecosystem (Huione Pay, USDH) remains active; affiliate Tudou Guarantee saw 70x inflow surge Xinbi Guarantee Banned by Telegram Initial disruption Rebounded with 90% volume jump The case of Tudou Guarantee, an affiliate of Huione, is particularly telling. Despite Huione’s ban and 50% volume drop, Tudou experienced an astounding 70x surge in illicit inflows. This suggests a rapid migration of activity from the blocked entity to its interconnected components. Similarly, Xinbi Guarantee, after an initial hit, demonstrated remarkable resilience, rebounding with a 90% volume jump. This swift adaptation underscores the challenges in eradicating these networks entirely. Moreover, CoinDesk reported that Huione’s broader ecosystem, including services like Huione Pay and its stablecoin USDH, remained active even after the Telegram ban and U.S. sanctions. This indicates that these networks are not merely Telegram groups; they are multi-faceted operations with various components that can continue to function independently or find new avenues for coordination. The fight against illicit crypto activity is not a one-time event but an ongoing, dynamic struggle requiring continuous vigilance and adaptive strategies from all stakeholders. US Pressure and Global Implications for Illicit Crypto Activity The role of U.S. authorities in this crackdown cannot be overstated. Their designation of Huione as a money-laundering threat and the subsequent sanctions on related wallets were pivotal. This demonstrates a growing global commitment to combatting illicit crypto activity , moving beyond mere rhetoric to concrete actions that impact the operational capabilities of these networks. The implications of such pressure are far-reaching: Increased Platform Accountability: Messaging apps and social media platforms are increasingly being held accountable for the illicit activities conducted on their services. This could lead to more proactive measures from these platforms to monitor and remove criminal elements. Enhanced International Cooperation: The effectiveness of these crackdowns often relies on collaboration between national law enforcement agencies, financial intelligence units, and private sector entities. The Telegram case serves as a powerful example of such cooperation yielding results. Regulatory Evolution: As criminals adapt, so too must regulations. We can expect to see further evolution in anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorism financing (CTF) frameworks specifically tailored to the unique challenges posed by cryptocurrencies. Shifting Criminal Tactics: While bans disrupt existing operations, they also push criminals to seek out new, less regulated platforms or more sophisticated methods of evasion. This constant adaptation necessitates continuous innovation in detection and enforcement. The U.S. approach signals a global trend where major economies are becoming more assertive in addressing crypto-related financial crime. This pressure is not just about sanctions; it’s about setting precedents and encouraging a global standard for responsible digital asset management and security. Navigating the Future: Combating Persistent Illicit Crypto Activity The Telegram ban, while a victory, is merely one battle in a protracted war against illicit crypto activity . The immediate shift of operations to affiliate networks and the resilience of entities like Xinbi highlight the persistent challenges. So, what does the future hold, and how can we collectively navigate this complex landscape? For Platforms and Regulators: Proactive Monitoring: Moving beyond reactive bans to proactive identification of suspicious networks and affiliated entities. Enhanced Collaboration: Strengthening partnerships between tech companies, law enforcement, and financial institutions across borders. Adaptive Strategies: Developing AI and machine learning tools to detect evolving patterns of illicit behavior. Clearer Guidelines: Establishing comprehensive, internationally harmonized regulatory frameworks that address the nuances of crypto crime. For Individual Users: Vigilance is Key: Always be skeptical of unsolicited offers, especially those promising unrealistic returns. Verify Sources: Double-check the legitimacy of any crypto-related service or individual before engaging. Secure Your Assets: Use strong, unique passwords, enable two-factor authentication (2FA), and consider hardware wallets for significant holdings. Report Suspicious Activity: If something feels off, report it to the relevant authorities or platform administrators. Your vigilance can protect others. The fight against illicit crypto activity is a shared responsibility. While platforms and governments play a crucial role in enforcement and regulation, individual users must also arm themselves with knowledge and caution. The digital realm is a frontier, and just like any frontier, it requires careful navigation to avoid its dangers. Telegram’s recent actions serve as a powerful testament to the ongoing struggle against sophisticated financial crime in the digital age. While the bans on Huione and Xinbi Guarantee delivered a significant blow to their operations, the swift adaptation of these networks underscores the ‘whack-a-mole’ nature of combating illicit crypto activity . This incident highlights the critical role of platforms, the growing assertiveness of U.S. and international authorities, and the undeniable need for continuous innovation in detection and enforcement. As the crypto ecosystem matures, the collective vigilance of users, coupled with robust regulatory frameworks and proactive platform measures, will be essential in safeguarding the integrity and future potential of digital assets. The battle is far from over, but each decisive action brings us closer to a safer digital financial world. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What is considered illicit crypto activity? Illicit crypto activity refers to the use of cryptocurrencies for illegal purposes, including but not limited to money laundering, financing terrorism, fraud, scams (like ‘pig butchering’ or Ponzi schemes), drug trafficking, and ransomware payments. These activities often exploit the pseudonymous nature and cross-border capabilities of digital assets. 2. Why did Telegram ban Huione and Xinbi Guarantee? Telegram banned Huione and Xinbi Guarantee primarily due to pressure from U.S. authorities, who identified these networks as major facilitators of money laundering and other illicit financial activities. These entities were reportedly tied to billions of dollars in illegal USDT trades, making their continued operation a significant concern for regulators. 3. How do these scam networks typically operate on platforms like Telegram? These networks often use messaging platforms like Telegram for communication, recruitment, and coordination. They might create large groups or channels to lure victims with promises of high returns (e.g., investment scams), or facilitate large-scale money laundering by connecting illicit funds with legitimate-looking transactions. They leverage the platform’s features for encrypted communication and group management to evade detection. 4. What role do U.S. authorities play in combating illicit crypto activity? U.S. authorities, including the Treasury Department (especially OFAC) and law enforcement agencies, play a significant role by identifying, sanctioning, and disrupting illicit financial networks. They use their jurisdiction and influence to pressure platforms and financial institutions to comply with anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorism financing (CTF) regulations, often targeting wallets and entities involved in illicit crypto activity . 5. What should individual users do to protect themselves from crypto scams? Individual users should always exercise extreme caution. Key steps include verifying the legitimacy of any crypto-related offer or service, being wary of unsolicited messages promising high returns, using strong and unique passwords with two-factor authentication (2FA), storing significant crypto holdings in hardware wallets, and reporting any suspicious activity to relevant authorities or platform support. 6. Will Telegram’s ban effectively stop these illicit activities? While Telegram’s ban significantly disrupts the operations of specific networks like Huione and Xinbi, it is unlikely to stop all illicit crypto activity entirely. Criminal networks are highly adaptive and often shift their operations to affiliate channels, other platforms, or develop new evasion tactics. The ban is a crucial step, but the fight against crypto crime is an ongoing, dynamic challenge requiring continuous vigilance and multi-faceted strategies. If you found this article insightful, please consider sharing it on your social media platforms to help raise awareness about the persistent threat of illicit crypto activity and the ongoing efforts to combat it. Your share can make a difference in informing others and fostering a safer crypto environment! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping blockchain security and the future of digital assets. This post Illicit Crypto Activity: Telegram’s Decisive Crackdown Escalates War on $35B Scam Networks first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Brazil’s central bank is expected to maintain the Selic rate at 15%
body: President Donald Trump’s anticipated 50% tariff on Brazil could undercut the central bank’s extended high-interest rate strategy. The American president is expected to levy the taxes against Brazil this week. Still, with Gabriel Galipolo at the helm, Brazil’s central bank will likely leave the Selic rate unchanged at 15% on Wednesday, according to Bloomberg. The central bank stated previously that it would like to maintain high rates Analysts also believe Brazil will maintain its rates despite the tariff threat. For instance, analysts led by Cassiana Fernandez, head of economic research for Latin America at JPMorgan, remarked, “Any decision other than keeping rates unchanged at 15% would be a surprise.” Limited public commentary has also suggested a strong consensus among board members on sustaining elevated interest rates. Most central bankers support high rates to rein in inflation, which is expected to stay above 3% target through 2028. However, unemployment rates are still growing, and there are signs of a possible economic recession . Besides, the looming threat of a trade war with the US, possibly starting August 1, adds further uncertainty and calls for a more cautious policy approach. Earlier, Brazil’s central bank had communicated plans to hold rates high for an extended time, but that was before the U.S. President said he would slap a 50% tariff. While a rate shift is unlikely, the development may alter the tone of the central bank’s rhetoric. The bank has raised its benchmark rate by 4.5 percentage points for over seven consecutive moves, then paused in June to observe the impact on inflation. In the same period, other Latin American central banks, such as those in Mexico and Chile, chose to lower interest rates. President Luiz’s ratings rose this week, with the US officials’ engagement in negotiations Trump has vowed to implement a 50% tariff on Brazilian exports in response to what he claims is a politically motivated “witch hunt” against former president and close ally Jair Bolsonaro. However, US officials appear more open to discussing better terms this week, which quickly lifted President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva’s approval ratings, improving his 2026 reelection prospects. However, some investors worry President Lula’s growing support could lead to fiscal deterioration, warning of a weaker currency and inflation. In mid-July, annual inflation rose to 5.3%, while economic activity declined in May, accelerated by downturns in sectors such as industry and retail. Caio Megale, XP Inc.’s chief economist, also noted that while the exchange rate outlook is still highly uncertain, the potential political fallout from US tariffs cannot be ruled out. Additionally, Iana Ferrao, an economist at BTG Pactual, argued that Brazil’s central bank will likely recognize emerging risks to the domestic economy. He stated, “Increased regulatory uncertainty tends to negatively affect investment and consumption decisions, especially in an environment of slowing activity, restricted credit, and high financial costs.” On Wednesday, policymakers will post their rate decision and a corresponding statement on the central bank’s website after 6:30 p.m. Brasília time. The release will follow the Federal Reserve’s likely decision to hold rates steady while assessing the potential impact of tariffs on inflation. Get seen where it counts. Advertise in Cryptopolitan Research and reach crypto’s sharpest investors and builders.

title: Telegram Handle @Crypto: A Phenomenal $25 Million Valuation
body: BitcoinWorld Telegram Handle @Crypto: A Phenomenal $25 Million Valuation Imagine turning a $350,000 investment into a staggering $25 million in just a few months. This isn’t a speculative stock market tale or a venture capital dream; it’s the real-world story of a specific Telegram handle , ‘@Crypto’. In a development that has sent ripples across the digital asset landscape, a user who acquired this coveted username in 2023 for a considerable sum has now reportedly received an offer twenty-five million dollars for it. This remarkable valuation highlights the burgeoning potential and unique characteristics of digital assets secured on blockchain networks like TON. It forces us to reconsider what truly holds value in our increasingly digital world. What Makes a Telegram Handle So Valuable? At first glance, it might seem perplexing that a simple username could command such an astronomical price. However, understanding the underlying principles of digital ownership and the specific ecosystem of Telegram and the TON blockchain sheds light on this phenomenon. The value of a Telegram handle , particularly one as iconic as ‘@Crypto’, stems from several key factors: Scarcity and Uniqueness: Unlike traditional social media handles that can sometimes be duplicated or are centrally controlled, Telegram usernames are secured as unique digital assets on the TON (The Open Network) blockchain. This means each handle is one-of-a-kind and cannot be replicated. The ‘@Crypto’ handle, being a generic and highly sought-after term, represents a premium piece of digital real estate due to its inherent scarcity. Branding and Prestige: For businesses, influencers, or communities operating within the vast Telegram ecosystem, owning a highly recognizable and relevant Telegram handle offers immense branding opportunities. An address like ‘@Crypto’ immediately conveys authority, relevance, and prestige within the cryptocurrency space. It acts as a digital billboard, instantly communicating the owner’s domain. Utility and Accessibility: A premium Telegram handle isn’t just a status symbol; it’s a practical tool. It simplifies discovery, makes communication more efficient, and serves as a memorable identifier for millions of users. For projects, media outlets, or individuals in the crypto space, owning ‘@Crypto’ provides unparalleled visibility and ease of access for their target audience. Investment Potential: As evidenced by the $25 million offer, these handles are increasingly viewed as speculative investments, similar to premium domain names or unique NFTs. Their value can appreciate significantly based on market demand, utility, and the overall growth of the platform they represent. The TON Blockchain: Securing Digital Ownership of Your Telegram Handle The foundation of this incredible valuation lies in the innovative technology powering Telegram’s username marketplace: the TON blockchain. Launched originally by Telegram itself, TON has evolved into a decentralized, community-driven network designed for speed, scalability, and user-friendliness. Here’s how it underpins the value of a Telegram handle : The TON blockchain ensures that: Unique Registration: When a user purchases a Telegram handle , that ownership is immutably recorded on the TON blockchain. This decentralized ledger acts as a public, tamper-proof record of who owns which username, eliminating disputes and ensuring genuine scarcity. Secure Transfers: The process of buying and selling these handles occurs on the TON blockchain, leveraging smart contracts to facilitate secure and transparent transactions. This mechanism protects both buyer and seller, ensuring that the asset changes hands only when all conditions are met. Decentralized Marketplace: Telegram’s username marketplace operates on TON, allowing users to bid on and acquire unique handles in an open and fair environment. This creates a liquid market where the true value of a Telegram handle is determined by supply and demand, rather than a centralized authority. Integration with Telegram: The deep integration between Telegram and the TON blockchain creates a powerful ecosystem. Users can seamlessly manage their crypto assets, access decentralized applications (dApps), and own digital identities directly within the messaging app, enhancing the utility and desirability of TON-based assets like usernames. This robust infrastructure transforms a simple username into a verifiable, transferable, and valuable digital asset, setting it apart from traditional social media handles. From $350,000 to $25 Million: The Phenomenal Rise of a Telegram Handle The journey of the ‘@Crypto’ Telegram handle from a $350,000 purchase to a $25 million offer is a compelling case study in digital asset appreciation. While the exact reasons for the initial owner’s decision to sell are unknown, the exponential increase in its perceived value can be attributed to several market dynamics: This incredible surge in value reflects: Increased Awareness and Adoption of TON: Since the initial purchase, the TON ecosystem has gained significant traction, with more users and projects recognizing its potential. As the network grows, so does the intrinsic value of its native assets, including unique usernames. Growing Demand for Premium Digital Identity: In an increasingly digital world, a strong online identity is paramount. Premium handles like ‘@Crypto’ are rare commodities that offer instant recognition and credibility, making them highly desirable for large entities or individuals looking to establish a dominant presence. Speculative Interest: The crypto market is no stranger to speculation, and high-profile assets often attract significant investor interest. The sheer prominence of a term like ‘Crypto’ within the blockchain sphere makes this particular Telegram handle a prime target for those looking for high-growth digital assets. Network Effects: As Telegram continues to expand its user base and integrate more Web3 features, the network effects amplify the value of its associated digital assets. A larger, more engaged user base means greater visibility and utility for a prominent Telegram handle . This trajectory underscores the rapid evolution of value perception in the digital realm, where scarcity, utility, and market sentiment can converge to create unprecedented wealth. Are Telegram Handles the Next Frontier in Digital Assets? The ‘@Crypto’ saga begs the question: are we witnessing the emergence of a new, significant digital asset class? While it’s still early, the potential for Telegram handles to become a widely recognized and traded asset class is certainly compelling. They share characteristics with other successful digital assets: Feature Telegram Handle NFTs (e.g., CryptoPunks) Premium Domain Names Uniqueness/Scarcity Yes (on TON blockchain) Yes (one-of-a-kind) Yes (only one .com) Branding Value High (identity, reach) Medium to High (community, art) High (business, memorability) Utility Communication, identity, marketing PFP, access, gaming Website, email, branding Investment Potential High (emerging market) High (established, volatile) Medium to High (stable, niche) Underlying Tech TON Blockchain Ethereum, Solana etc. DNS System However, like all emerging asset classes, challenges remain. Market volatility, regulatory uncertainty, and the need for broader adoption of the TON ecosystem are factors that will influence their long-term trajectory. Yet, the clear utility and inherent scarcity of a desirable Telegram handle suggest a promising future in the broader Web3 landscape. Navigating the High-Value World of Digital Assets: Actionable Insights for Telegram Handle Enthusiasts For those intrigued by the potential of digital assets like premium Telegram usernames, here are some actionable insights: Do Your Research: Before investing in any Telegram handle , understand its market value, potential utility, and the demand for specific keywords or names. Tools and marketplaces on the TON network can provide insights into recent sales and active bids. Understand the TON Ecosystem: Familiarize yourself with how the TON blockchain works, including its wallets, marketplaces, and security protocols. This knowledge is crucial for safe and effective participation in the digital asset market. Consider Long-Term Value: While speculative gains are tempting, evaluate the long-term utility and branding potential of a Telegram handle . Generic, highly relevant terms tend to hold value better than niche or obscure ones. Security is Paramount: If you acquire a high-value Telegram handle , ensure your associated TON wallet and Telegram account are secured with strong, unique passwords, two-factor authentication (2FA), and proper seed phrase management. Digital assets are only as secure as their weakest link. Stay Informed: The digital asset space evolves rapidly. Keep up-to-date with developments on the TON blockchain, Telegram’s features, and broader market trends that could impact the value of your digital holdings. The ‘@Crypto’ Telegram handle story serves as a powerful reminder that value is increasingly being redefined in the digital realm. As our online lives become more intertwined with blockchain technology, unique digital identities and assets will continue to command significant attention and, potentially, astounding valuations. The astonishing $25 million offer for the ‘@Crypto’ Telegram handle is more than just a headline; it’s a profound indicator of the shifting paradigms of ownership and value in the digital age. It underscores the immense potential of unique digital assets secured on robust blockchain networks like TON. This event solidifies the idea that a seemingly simple username can evolve into a highly sought-after, multi-million-dollar commodity, driven by scarcity, utility, and the ever-growing demand for a distinct digital presence. As the Web3 space continues to mature, we can expect to see more such remarkable valuations, further blurring the lines between the tangible and the digital, and cementing the role of digital assets as a significant part of our economic future. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is a Telegram handle and how is it different from a regular username? A Telegram handle, also known as a username, is a unique identifier (e.g., @Crypto) that allows users to be found and contacted on Telegram without sharing their phone number. Unlike traditional usernames, specific premium Telegram handles are secured as unique digital assets on the TON blockchain, meaning they are verifiable, transferable, and can be bought and sold. Q2: What is the TON blockchain and how does it relate to Telegram handles? TON (The Open Network) is a decentralized blockchain network originally developed by Telegram. It acts as the underlying infrastructure for securing and managing unique digital assets, including Telegram usernames. When a Telegram handle is purchased, its ownership is recorded on the TON blockchain, ensuring its uniqueness and enabling secure transfers. Q3: Why would someone pay $25 million for a Telegram handle? The high valuation stems from a combination of factors: extreme scarcity for generic, highly desirable terms like ‘@Crypto’, significant branding and marketing potential for businesses or individuals, the utility of a memorable digital identity, and its classification as a unique digital asset with investment potential within the growing Web3 ecosystem. Q4: Are all Telegram handles considered valuable digital assets? No, not all Telegram handles hold high value. Only unique, premium, or highly sought-after handles that are registered and traded on the TON blockchain’s marketplace are considered valuable digital assets. Common or randomly generated usernames typically do not command significant prices. Q5: How can I buy or sell a Telegram handle? Telegram handles can be bought and sold on decentralized marketplaces built on the TON blockchain, such as Fragment. These platforms allow users to bid on available usernames, and transactions are secured using smart contracts on the TON network. title: How Ecosystem Milestones and Market Signals Aligned Perfectly for $FUN Price Spike
body: FunToken is no longer just a speculative GameFi asset; it’s evolving into a credible infrastructure token for the decentralized gaming space. Its recent market momentum isn’t accidental or hype-driven. Instead, it reflects a deliberate alignment of key ecosystem developments, deflationary token mechanics, and strong technical indicators. With over 3 billion mobile gamers globally and a rising appetite for play-to-earn models, FUNToken’s expanding use cases, from staking and tipping bots to AI-integrated gaming experiences, are capturing the attention of both users and investors. Add in the recent Uniswap liquidity surge, cross-chain bridge announcements, and consistent token burns, and the stage was set for a price breakout. These ecosystem milestones didn’t just generate excitement; they laid the foundation for sustainable growth. As a result, FUNToken has transitioned from a niche altcoin into one of the most watched players in Web3 gaming. It’s no longer a question of potential; it’s about execution, and FUN is delivering. Snapshot: Market Momentum Meets Fundamentals At the time of writing (July 3, 2025), FUNToken is trading between $0.0101 and $0.0114, with a 24-hour volume exceeding $30 million. This sharp uptick is not a fleeting event—it reflects a deeper narrative: product maturity meeting market readiness. Market Stats: Price Range: $0.01323 24h Volume: $36M+ Market Cap: ~$143M RSI: 77 (Bullish) MACD: Positive divergence The numbers show clear bullish indicators. But what’s driving them? Core Catalysts: Ecosystem Milestones Driving Demand $1M Liquidity Launch on Uniswap The first real inflection point came with the Uniswap listing. Backed by $1 million in locked liquidity, the listing wasn’t a marketing stunt but rather it was a structural move to increase access, reduce slippage, and signal to institutional DeFi players that FUN is playing for keeps. 25 Million Token Burn FunToken executed one of its most significant deflationary moves to date by permanently burning 25 million FUN tokens. This wasn’t just a symbolic gesture; it marked a serious commitment to long-term value creation and scarcity. With a fixed supply model and no future minting on the roadmap, the burn tightened the circulating supply and sent a clear message to the market: FUN is built to reward holders, not dilute them. The move immediately boosted investor sentiment, reinforcing FUN’s image as a deflationary asset with real economic utility. For long-term holders, the burn was both a confidence booster and a value catalyst. 40+ GameFi Integrations While most GameFi tokens rely on future promises, FunToken has already planned on scaling up to 40 integrated games using FUN for real in-game rewards, tipping, and staking. This utility promise sets it apart in a crowded market, creating constant demand and on-chain movement. Each integration adds depth to FUN’s ecosystem, reinforcing its role as the transactional backbone of Web3 gaming. With more titles in the pipeline, this utility base continues to support organic growth and long-term price traction. Telegram Bot Ecosystem With 100K+ bot users, FUN’s integration into Telegram has created a frictionless, borderless playground for micro-tipping and real-time interactions. This isn’t passive speculation; it’s active utility in motion. Roadmap Alignment: Timing That Made the Spike Inevitable Here’s how FunToken’s roadmap directly aligned with its price action: Milestone Date Market Impact Uniswap Listing June 2025 $1M Liquidity = Price Stability & Access Token Burn June 2025 25M Tokens Removed = Scarcity Boost GameFi Integrations (40+) Ongoing Real Utility = Daily Transactions Telegram Bot Growth Q2–Q3 2025 100K+ Users = Constant Engagement Staking Wallet Launch Q4 2025 5% APY = Investor Retention The market didn’t just respond to a single news item. It responded to multiple, compounding triggers that all pointed in one direction: long-term sustainability. Community Reaction: Bottom-Up Bullishness Community sentiment has been overwhelmingly positive: Telegram: 92K+ members Bot Users : 100K+ daily interactions X (formerly Twitter): 61K+ followers On Telegram , users have praised the real-time tipping system and community quizzes. On X , influencers have started tagging FUN as one of the few tokens "executing with precision, not promises." Why This Isn’t Just Another Pump Here’s what separates FUNToken from short-lived GameFi surges: No New Minting: Scarcity is built-in. CertiK Audit: Security and transparency are confirmed. Cross-Platform Utility: Plans to integrate FUN within external gaming ecosystems. Grassroots Growth: No reliance on venture capital or marketing hype. Final Take: Ecosystem Strength + Market Timing = Sustainable Rally FUNToken ’s recent price surge isn’t the result of sudden hype or an external catalyst. It’s the inevitable outcome of a project hitting its roadmap milestones on time, delivering measurable utility, and earning the trust of a growing user base. Whether it’s the locked Uniswap liquidity, the deflationary supply, the rising GameFi integrations, or the grassroots Telegram engagement, every component of the FUNToken ecosystem is pushing in the same direction. If the team maintains this pace of delivery and if market sentiment remains aligned, 2025 could be the year FUNToken steps fully into the GameFi spotlight. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: South Korea's Leading Company Announces Launch of Blockchain Ecosystem on This Altcoin Network! Here Are the Details
body: Daehong Communications, a subsidiary of Lotte Group, one of South Korea’s leading conglomerates, announced the launch of a new “money movement” focused blockchain ecosystem on the Aptos blockchain. At the time of writing, the price of Aptos (APT) was trading around $4.53. Lotte Group Subsidiary Daehong Communications Launches Blockchain Ecosystem on Aptos In the first phase of the project, Giftiel, Daehong Communications' mobile gift voucher service, was integrated with the Aptos blockchain. This move aims to make digital coupon and mobile gift systems more transparent, secure, and traceable by moving them to the blockchain infrastructure. Lotte Group, one of South Korea's largest retail and business groups, is also stepping up its digital transformation efforts with investments in blockchain and Web3 technologies. This integration of Daehong Communications is considered the first step in Lotte's broader vision for blockchain-based payment and loyalty systems. *This is not investment advice.
